body:

```
#0 4.128 /app/vendor/bundle/ruby/2.7.0/gems/bootsnap-1.9.1/lib/bootsnap/load_path_cache/core_ext/kernel_require.rb:31:in `require'
#0 4.128 bin/rails:4:in `<main>'
#0 4.128 (See full trace by running task with --trace)
```

This might come from this [commit](https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/commit/345ba002bc7035d8135d58f4c5dad6dadef298dc).

The file lib/sidekiq/job_retry.rb was requiring `require "sidekiq/scheduled"` which requires `require "sidekiq/component"`.
Look at the backtrace. The error is coming from sidekiq-status code loading.
The class Sidekiq::JobRetry is including `include Sidekiq::Component` on line 66, but it is required nowhere. Do I misunderstand something?

issue.title: Error introduced in 6.5.4 - `uninitialized constant Sidekiq::Component`

repository.name: sidekiq
repository.description: Simple, efficient background processing for Ruby

issue.body:
Ruby version: 3.1.2
Rails version: 7.0.3.1
Sidekiq / Pro / Enterprise version(s): 6.5.4

I was able to pin at 6.5.3 and everything works as expected. Upgrading to 6.5.4 I receive the following:

```
    /usr/local/bundle/gems/sidekiq-6.5.4/lib/sidekiq/job_retry.rb:66:in `<class:JobRetry>': uninitialized constant Sidekiq::Component (NameError)

    include Sidekiq::Component
                   ^^^^^^^^^^^
    Did you mean?  CompositeIO
```

```
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/sidekiq-6.5.4/lib/sidekiq/job_retry.rb:61:in `<module:Sidekiq>'
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/sidekiq-6.5.4/lib/sidekiq/job_retry.rb:6:in `<main>'

        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/bootsnap-1.13.0/lib/bootsnap/load_path_cache/core_ext/kernel_require.rb:32:in `require'
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/bootsnap-1.13.0/lib/bootsnap/load_path_cache/core_ext/kernel_require.rb:32:in `require'
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/sidekiq-status-2.1.3/lib/sidekiq-status.rb:6:in `<main>'
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/bootsnap-1.13.0/lib/bootsnap/load_path_cache/core_ext/kernel_require.rb:32:in `require'
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/bootsnap-1.13.0/lib/bootsnap/load_path_cache/core_ext/kernel_require.rb:32:in `require'
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/bundler-2.3.19/lib/bundler/runtime.rb:60:in `block (2 levels) in require'
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/bundler-2.3.19/lib/bundler/runtime.rb:55:in `each'
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/bundler-2.3.19/lib/bundler/runtime.rb:55:in `block in require'
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/bundler-2.3.19/lib/bundler/runtime.rb:44:in `each'
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/bundler-2.3.19/lib/bundler/runtime.rb:44:in `require'
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/bundler-2.3.19/lib/bundler.rb:188:in `require'
        from /usr/src/app/config/application.rb:21:in `<main>'
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/bootsnap-1.13.0/lib/bootsnap/load_path_cache/core_ext/kernel_require.rb:32:in `require'
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/bootsnap-1.13.0/lib/bootsnap/load_path_cache/core_ext/kernel_require.rb:32:in `require'
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/railties-7.0.3.1/lib/rails/commands/server/server_command.rb:137:in `block in perform'
        from <internal:kernel>:90:in `tap'
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/railties-7.0.3.1/lib/rails/commands/server/server_command.rb:134:in `perform'
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/thor-1.2.1/lib/thor/command.rb:27:in `run'
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/thor-1.2.1/lib/thor/invocation.rb:127:in `invoke_command'
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/thor-1.2.1/lib/thor.rb:392:in `dispatch'
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/railties-7.0.3.1/lib/rails/command/base.rb:87:in `perform'
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/railties-7.0.3.1/lib/rails/command.rb:48:in `invoke'
        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/railties-7.0.3.1/lib/rails/commands.rb:18:in `<main>'

        from /usr/local/bundle/gems/bootsnap-1.13.0/lib/bootsnap/load_path_cache/core_ext/kernel_require.rb:32:in `require'
        from bin/rails:5:in `<main>'

```

I think the removal of the `require` here is causing a downstream effect: https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/compare/v6.5.3..v6.5.4#diff-a2a78bd5586e1300341bb91dc8be382aa98126dcde11bd507fe9886d2e643ee7L3

body:
> The class Sidekiq::JobRetry is including `include Sidekiq::Component` on line 66, but it is required nowhere. Do I misunderstand something?

It is only required in the Sidekiq server process. You cannot load server components in a client process.
Does this mean there is a bug in `sidekiq-status`? I am not entirely sure of the fix here.

Yes. They are requiring server components when they shouldn’t.


Sidekiq.configure_server do |config|
  require "sidekiq-status/server_middleware"
end

issue.title: Breaking sidekiq v6.5.4
issue.body:
The latest version of sidekiq is breaking the gem - https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/issues/5462#issuecomment-1209985257

I am not sure what the fix is for this Gem.

Additional details on what is breaking can be found in the link above.

issue.title: Upgrades to 6.5.4 are broken

repository.name: sidekiq
repository.description: Simple, efficient background processing for Ruby

issue.body:
Ruby version: 3.1.1
Rails version: 7.0.3.1
Sidekiq / Pro / Enterprise version(s): **6.5.4**

In `6.5.4`, `include Sidekiq::Component` is used before Component is required: https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/compare/v6.5.1...v6.5.4#diff-db72e89711ace18a479c59a7cbb5cbf929670cd7f73b334dfe4d8c338af0e280R9

```
NameError: uninitialized constant Sidekiq::Component

    include Sidekiq::Component
                    ^^^^^^^^^^^
Did you mean?  CompositeIO
/app/config/initializers/sidekiq.rb:4:in `<main>'
/app/config/environment.rb:8:in `<main>'
```

body:
In my case, I'm not requiring any server component in client code. I'm trying to test a custom sidekiq logger that uses job_retry.

I think the fact that job_retry doesn't require component is a smell, that you can see in sidekiq's own test suite https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/compare/v6.5.1...v6.5.4#diff-f9cb8a684c3b818b3e8866b7fb8a95cea48673d567a810811b531ce4c2bc6d29R4.

I see no reason why my test would need to require component other than it is requiring `job_retry`, but that dependency isn't clear anywhere. If `job_retry` need component I think it should be requiring it, or at least, a clear API for requiring `job_retry` should be provided and its dependencies.
That's fair enough. I can see how it's difficult to create an integration test for X if X doesn't require its dependencies.
So for the rest of us, how do we fix this in 6.5.4?  I dont have `sidekiq-status` anywhere in my code and Im using a vanilla install of sidekiq.
@noctivityinc You open up your own issue with a backtrace and I diagnose it for you.

@mperham will the patch https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/commit/9d5a6d7fa7edba006db86fc520fbcd353005cf9c be included in a 6.5.x series release or 7 directly? thanks

```
+ bin/rails db:create
rails aborted!
NameError: uninitialized constant Sidekiq::Component

    include Sidekiq::Component
                   ^^^^^^^^^^^
Did you mean?  CompositeIO
```

That commit is on main which means it will go into 6.5.5.

issue.title: build(deps): bump sidekiq from 6.5.3 to 6.5.4

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: ruby
labels.description: Pull requests that update Ruby code

repository.name: laa-apply-for-legal-aid
repository.description: The laa-apply-for-legal-aid system is a web service by use for solicitors providing legal aid services to enter applications for legal aid on-line.  It asks for details of applicant means (income and assets), and the merits of a case, and gives a decision on whether legal aid can be granted or not, and if so, will push the application through to back-end processes for payment.

issue.body:
Bumps [sidekiq](https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq) from 6.5.3 to 6.5.4.
Changelog

Sourced from sidekiq's changelog.

6.5.4

  • Fix invalid code on Ruby 2.5 #5460
  • Fix further metrics dependency issues #5457
Commits
  • 7003aeb change
  • acdaa85 rejigger logic for ruby 2.5
  • c763b42 See if ruby 2.5 works in github
  • e464c09 Remove another usage of API within server code
  • 77fc95a Remove unnecessary code, bump
  • 345ba00 Sidekiq server should never require sidekiq/api
  • c61f21f Fix api
  • See full diff in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=sidekiq&package-manager=bundler&previous-version=6.5.3&new-version=6.5.4)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

issue.title: uninitialized constant Sidekiq::Component after upgrading from 7.2.4 to 7.3.0

repository.name: sidekiq
repository.description: Simple, efficient background processing for Ruby

issue.body:
Ruby version: 3.2.2p53
Rails version: 7.1.3.4
Sidekiq / Pro / Enterprise version(s): 7.3.0

Please include your initializer, sidekiq.yml, and any error message with the full backtrace.

```
                   ^^^^^^^^^^^
Did you mean?  Complex
        from /Users/bobgardner/.rvm/gems/ruby-3.2.2/gems/sidekiq-7.3.0/lib/sidekiq/job_logger.rb:4:in `<module:Sidekiq>'
        from /Users/bobgardner/.rvm/gems/ruby-3.2.2/gems/sidekiq-7.3.0/lib/sidekiq/job_logger.rb:3:in `<main>'

```

This is, in essence, a reoccurrence of #5462 but in a new file. 6677b45 added `include Sidekiq::Component` to `job_logger.rb` but did not add `require "sidekiq/component"` (as in 9d5a6d7). [sidekiq-logstash](https://github.com/iMacTia/sidekiq-logstash) has [`LogstashJobLogger`](https://github.com/iMacTia/sidekiq-logstash/blob/master/lib/sidekiq/logstash_job_logger.rb) that inherits from `Sidekiq::JobLogger`, which leads to the error above during loading. I've confirmed that adding `require "sidekiq/component"` in `job_logger.rb` fixes the error for me.
